channel.title: [New-PI] ItemonObject Packet not working as expected?
channel.description:
So this is really weird, and something I've never experienced before. I was trying to add in support for smithing and when I was adding the use item on object (meaning using the bars on the object) it wouldn't work. Couldn't figure out why. First, I blamed the case, and then I blamed the interface. Neither were wrong. So I added debug code: [code=java] if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Sk8r")){ c.sendMessage("ItemOnObject: "+objectID+" Item:"+itemId); } [/code]
And this is what prints out.. [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/4r7CsIh.png[/img]
I used the bronze bar (Item ID: 2349) on 4 objects (a tree, cooking utensils, altar, and something else). Obviously that isn't correct. Why is it messing up like this? Lol.

item.title: [New-PI] ItemonObject Packet not working as expected?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So this is really weird, and something I’ve never experienced before.
I was trying to add in support for smithing and when I was adding the use item on object (meaning using the bars on the object) it wouldn’t work. Couldn’t figure out why. First, I blamed the case, and then I blamed the interface. Neither were wrong.
So I added debug code:

		if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Sk8r")){
			c.sendMessage("ItemOnObject: "+objectID+" Item:"+itemId);
		}

And this is what prints out…

I used the bronze bar (Item ID: 2349) on 4 objects (a tree, cooking utensils, altar, and something else).
Obviously that isn’t correct. Why is it messing up like this? Lol.

Read full topic
